Class GameInputHandler

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controller.GameInputHandler
public class GameInputHandler extends Object
Handles keyboard input for the Tetris game. Processes arrow keys, WASD keys, and the new game key (N).

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • GameInputHandler

      public GameInputHandler(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gamePanel, InputEventListener eventListener, javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty isPause, javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty isGameOver, Consumer<ViewData> refreshBrickCallback, Consumer<MoveEvent> moveDownCallback, Consumer<MoveEvent> hardDropCallback, Runnable newGameCallback)
      Creates a new GameInputHandler.
      Parameters:
      gamePanel - the GridPane to attach key event handlers to
      eventListener - the InputEventListener to process game events
      isPause - the BooleanProperty indicating if the game is paused
      isGameOver - the BooleanProperty indicating if the game is over
      refreshBrickCallback - callback to refresh the brick display
      moveDownCallback - callback to handle down movement
      hardDropCallback - callback to handle hard drop
      newGameCallback - callback to start a new game

  • Method Details

    • setEventListener

      public void setEventListener(InputEventListener eventListener)
      Updates the event listener reference. This is called after the event listener is set in GuiController.
      Parameters:
      eventListener - the new event listener to use

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes keyboard input handlers for game controls. Sets up event handlers for arrow keys, WASD keys, and the new game key (N).

    • setPauseToggleCallback

      public void setPauseToggleCallback(Runnable callback)
      Sets the callback to be invoked when ESC key is pressed to toggle pause.
      Parameters:
      callback - the Runnable to execute when pause is toggled
